title: pryce
author: pryce
created_time: May 23, 2023, 05:20:08 PMLast edit: June 16, 2023, 05:26:02 AM by pryce
content: PotreroCoin v0.14.2Potrero is a new digital cryptocurrency.website: https://potrerocoin.orgwhitepaper: https://github.com/PotreroCoin/PotreroCoinWindows InstallationBinary available for Win32 and Win64https://github.com/PotreroCoin/PotreroCoin/releases/tag/0.14.2Linux InstallationGUI and non-GUI (headless) binary must be compiled from the source code. Older Ubuntu distros (16.x, 18.x) are recommended to simplify the dependencies build procedure. PotreroCoin has been tested on Ubuntu, Debian, RaspberryPi OS.CommunityDiscord: https://discord.gg/9zqQHtRH9qSlack: https://app.slack.com/huddle/T05CKMV212S/C05CUQFRFHSTwitter: https://twitter.com/PotreroCoinFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/potrerocoin

comments.author: shell32
comments.body: Quote from: pryce on May 23, 2023, 05:20:08 PMPotreroCoin v0.14.2Potrero is a digital currency.Linux InstallationGUI and non-GUI (headless) binary needs to be compiled from the source code. Older Ubuntu distros (16.x, 18.x) are recommended to simplify the dependencies build procedure. PotreroCoin has been tested on Ubuntu, Debian, RaspberryPi OS.Windows InstallationBinary available for Win32 and Win64https://github.com/PotreroCoin/PotreroCoin/releases/tag/0.14.2There is no website, discord, block explorer? But there is a wallet for windows. To promote viruses, one cannot be lazy, one must imitate at least some seriousness of the project.

comments.author: pryce
comments.created_time: May 23, 2023, 09:27:58 PMLast edit: May 23, 2023, 09:51:26 PM by pryce
comments.body: Quote from: shell32 on May 23, 2023, 07:55:46 PMQuote from: pryce on May 23, 2023, 05:20:08 PMPotreroCoin v0.14.2Potrero is a digital currency.Linux InstallationGUI and non-GUI (headless) binary needs to be compiled from the source code. Older Ubuntu distros (16.x, 18.x) are recommended to simplify the dependencies build procedure. PotreroCoin has been tested on Ubuntu, Debian, RaspberryPi OS.Windows InstallationBinary available for Win32 and Win64https://github.com/PotreroCoin/PotreroCoin/releases/tag/0.14.2There is no website, discord, block explorer? But there is a wallet for windows. To promote viruses, one cannot be lazy, one must imitate at least some seriousness of the project.Windows binaries are available for convenience. You can always build your own binaries you can trust from the source under any supported OS. As you mentioned, the potrerocoin.org website is currently down, but in any case, the GitHub link is the central distribution point and should be considered the source of truth. For additional support, PotreroCoin is on Discord as well as the IRC node mentioned on the GitHub project page.

comments.author: mr-miner
comments.body: website is linked in github an offline https://potrerocoin.orgexplorer not existsdiscord not existssome infos, example algo ..... missinglooks like: " i have an coin, do it"

comments.author: JohnnyMnemonic
comments.created_time: May 24, 2023, 05:24:24 PMLast edit: July 27, 2023, 02:38:20 AM by JohnnyMnemonic

comments.author: MiningCoinsPool
comments.body: Quote from: JohnnyMnemonic on May 24, 2023, 05:24:24 PMI think I figured it out.I tried the win64 last night and it didn't work out of the box. It didn't sync with the network, possibly due to my firewall, not sure. So I tried connecting directly to my buddy's node using the Debug Console with the command:addnode "34.127.37.138" onetryThere's gotta be a way to add nodes in the config file but I'm not there yet.Manually adding nodes feels like a real peer-to-peer cryptocurrency :-)Send me some Potreros if you found this useful.Potrero: PnnyHUJosLMNxUXJGw9ddHciPvX935N2FrThat does not mean it is an official one. Like you said, it is your buddy's node. which means he started to mine on his own, which makes it a fork of the blockchain. If we mine with this node, we mine on another chain than the official one. This is not the way.

It didn't sync with the network, possibly due to my firewall, not sure. So I tried connecting directly to my buddy's node using the Debug Console with the command:addnode "34.127.37.138" onetryThere's gotta be a way to add nodes in the config file but I'm not there yet.Manually adding nodes feels like a real peer-to-peer cryptocurrency :-)Send me some Potreros if you found this useful.Potrero: PnnyHUJosLMNxUXJGw9ddHciPvX935N2FrWith that node syncs but it had been mined since November.

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: Hey Guys,You who try to install nodes.Are you fully aware of what you are about to do? I would really like to know what motivates you to try installing a portfolio for a project about which there is no information. It is interesting that the project developers were able to develop a windows wallet with all its complexities and failed to build a simple website that illustrates the vision of the project.The project does not provide any visibility on any of the channels, including this announcements here, and the representative of the project is not active at all and is very stingy in answering all questions.

comments.author: pryce
comments.body: Quote from: Kavelj22 on May 26, 2023, 01:36:14 PMHey Guys,You who try to install nodes.Are you fully aware of what you are about to do? I would really like to know what motivates you to try installing a portfolio for a project about which there is no information. It is interesting that the project developers were able to develop a windows wallet with all its complexities and failed to build a simple website that illustrates the vision of the project.The project does not provide any visibility on any of the channels, including this announcements here, and the representative of the project is not active at all and is very stingy in answering all questions.You are right to feel this way. Potrero has been released rather in stealth mode while its developers are ironing out the bugs, however,the website you're talking about is up and running, check it out at https://potrerocoin.orgPotrero is not yet on Discord but community support is being provided on the following Freenet IRC channels: #potrero, #potrero-mining, #potrero-dev. Feel free to drop by https://webchat.freenode.netYour feedback, as long as it's constructive and not trolling, is important to developing the Potrero network.Follow @PotreroCoin on Twitter for upcoming announcements.

comments.author: pdneves
comments.body: Quote from: pryce on May 26, 2023, 03:58:12 PMYou are right to feel this way. Potrero has been released rather in stealth mode while its developers are ironing out the bugs, however,the website you're talking about is up and running, check it out at https://potrerocoin.orgPotrero is not yet on Discord but community support is being provided on the following Freenet IRC channels: #potrero, #potrero-mining, #potrero-dev. Feel free to drop by https://webchat.freenode.netYour feedback, as long as it's constructive and not trolling, is important to developing the Potrero network.Follow @PotreroCoin on Twitter for upcoming announcements.Thank you for the update, but you still not have given us any nodes to connect!

comments.author: JohnnyMnemonic
comments.body: Quote from: pdneves on May 26, 2023, 05:34:34 PMQuote from: pryce on May 26, 2023, 03:58:12 PMYou are right to feel this way. Potrero has been released rather in stealth mode while its developers are ironing out the bugs, however,the website you're talking about is up and running, check it out at https://potrerocoin.orgPotrero is not yet on Discord but community support is being provided on the following Freenet IRC channels: #potrero, #potrero-mining, #potrero-dev. Feel free to drop by https://webchat.freenode.netYour feedback, as long as it's constructive and not trolling, is important to developing the Potrero network.Follow @PotreroCoin on Twitter for upcoming announcements.Thank you for the update, but you still not have given us any nodes to connect! I'm not sure I understand what you mean. Your wallet should sync automatically. If that doesn't work for various reasons you can always connect manually to a good node via Debug > Console by typing:Code:addnode "34.127.37.138" onetrywhich IP belongs to the official Potrero mining pool (pool.potrerocoin.com - ping it to make sure).There may be a better way to do it, I don't know, but anyway, it's how got my wallet to work.Cheers!
